subject: History
title: The Children's Crusade
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Children's Crusade.

hook.text: In 1212, thousands of children marched toward the Holy Land believing God would part the sea for them.

buildup.text: A French shepherd boy named Stephen claimed Jesus told him to lead children to reclaim Jerusalem.

discovery.text: Some accounts say 30,000 children joined. Adults laughed at first, then grew horrified.

twist.text: The sea didn't part. Many children died of exposure. Others were allegedly sold into slavery.

climax.text: Historians debate what really happenedâ€”but the story exposed the era's dangerous mix of faith and desperation.

punchline.text: Innocence marched to war and never came home.

quiz.question: What did the children of the Children's Crusade expect to happen?
options: They would receive weapons from the Pope
God would part the sea so they could walk to Jerusalem
Muslim leaders would surrender peacefully to innocence
